title: torch.cuda.sparse.FloatTensor is not enabled.
body_html:
import torch

torch.sparse.FloatTensor(
    torch.LongTensor([[0, 1, 2]]),
    torch.FloatTensor([3,4,5]),
    torch.Size([10])).cuda()

on master, this fails with:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "sparse_cuda.py", line 6, in <module>
    torch.Size([10])).cuda()
RuntimeError: torch.cuda.sparse.FloatTensor is not enabled.

Workaround: manually initialize cuda (e.g., convert a dense tensor to cuda) before doing it on sparse.

This is almost certainly my fault (due to ATen CPU/CUDA split.)

body:
```
import torch

torch.sparse.FloatTensor(
    torch.LongTensor([[0, 1, 2]]),
    torch.FloatTensor([3,4,5]),
    torch.Size([10])).cuda()
```

on master, this fails with:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "sparse_cuda.py", line 6, in <module>
    torch.Size([10])).cuda()
RuntimeError: torch.cuda.sparse.FloatTensor is not enabled.
```

Workaround: manually initialize cuda (e.g., convert a dense tensor to cuda) before doing it on sparse.

This is almost certainly my fault (due to ATen CPU/CUDA split.)
